title: Update Google button to open Gmail and ensure frontend source is export-ready

requirements.summary: Change the AuthScreen "Continue with Google" button to open Gmail (https://mail.google.com) in a new tab while keeping existing i18n text and security rel attributes.
acceptanceCriteria: On AuthScreen, the anchor used by the "Continue with Google" button no longer points to https://accounts.google.com/signup.
Clicking the button opens https://mail.google.com in a new browser tab (target="_blank") with rel="noopener noreferrer" preserved.
The button text remains "Continue with Google" (use existing i18n key continue_with_google; do not add or change translations).

file_operations.description: Update the "Continue with Google" anchor href to https://mail.google.com while preserving target="_blank", rel="noopener noreferrer", and the existing i18n key usage (continue_with_google).

requirements.summary: Ensure the frontend portion of the project is included and buildable in the delivered full-project source export, reflecting the Gmail-link change.
acceptanceCriteria: The delivered output includes the complete frontend and backend directories (including configuration files like frontend/.env.example) needed to run/build the app.
No files are omitted that are required to install dependencies and start the app using the projectâ€™s existing tooling.
The included source matches the implemented change where the Google button opens https://mail.google.com.

file_operations.description: Add concise frontend run/build instructions and a note that the AuthScreen "Continue with Google" button opens https://mail.google.com, to support delivering a complete, buildable project source bundle.
